Articles

  • About
    January 1, 2021

    I’m a software architect at Atos Unify. More about me in LinkedIn.

    Over the years, with the help of my colleagues, we were granted a few patents.

    In December of 2020 I completed a Computer Science master’s degree at Florida Atlantic University, focusing on machine learning. The work I did for the master’s is collected here.

    The dropout vs. batch normalization term project became a peer-reviewed paper (with much help from the professors listed as co-authors). The free version of the paper is available here.

    I’m now a Ph.D. candidate, also focusing on machine learning, continuing the work I did for the master’s degree.
